Novr 21" 3.
Maj. Genl. Geo. H. Thomas.
Comdg Departmt. of the Cumberlands.
Chattanooga.
General:

Secretary of War has authorized the Governor of Ky. to ask that the most worthy non-commissioned Officer, or private in each Company in every Kentucky regiment within your Department, be detailed on the recruiting service -- with the two- fold view of flling up all the regiments -- and, if there are vacancies, of rewarding good conduct in the field, and activity in recruiting, by giving such detailed persons commission as 2nd Lieutenants in their respective Companies -- if no such vacancies exist a brevet 2nd Lieuts Commission will issue to each.
The object of this is to hasten the recruiting for old regiments.

Be kind enough to direct such details to report to Maj. W. H. Sidell U. S. A. and Asst. Pro. Mar Genl for Dist. of Ky. at Louisville Ky. who is acting in conjunction with the State authorities in this matter. Your early attention to this is deemed essential as we are thus engaged in filling up all regiments from this State.

By order of the Governor
(sgd) John Boyle
Adjt Genl of Ky

This letter forwarded to
Maj Genl Burnside &
Dept. of the Cumberland
Maj Genl Banks
Deptmt. of the Gulf
